alert.note: Alert for South Central Pinal County including Eloy, Picacho Peak State Park; Southeast Pinal County including Kearny, Mammoth, Oracle (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 7:16PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pinal County through 800 PM MST... At 715 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong to severe thunderstorm near Hayden, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kearny and Dudleyville. This includes the following highways... Route 77 between mile markers 123 and 134. Route 177 between mile markers 139 and 147. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: South Central Pinal County including Eloy, Picacho Peak State Park; Southeast Pinal County including Kearny, Mammoth, Oracle
